TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit Node extends Urho.Animatable

summary.para: Scene node that may contain components and child nodes.

remarks.para: Nodes are the building block of your application. Each Node has a 3D transform (position, rotation and scale), a name and an ID and can contain other nodes (child nodes). Your application starts life with a special kind of node, the Scene node.

To bring Nodes to life, you attach one or more components into it (. Components provide functionality from giving a node a visual representation, to emitting sound, to emitting light and many more. These are created either with their constructors and then by attaching them using the method or by calling the method which can do both operations in one call.
Here are some common scenarios, creating a a and a .

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Node which is tied to the .

MemberSignature.Value: public Node (IntPtr handle);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(native int handle) cil managed

Docs.param: Pointer to the raw unmanaged Urho object.
Docs.summary: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Node, given a raw pointer to an unmanaged object

remarks.para: This creates a new managed wrapper for the type using the raw pointer to an unmanaged object.
Objects that are created in this fashion get registered with the UrhoSharp runtime.
This is intended to be used by the UrhoSharp runtime, and is not intended to be used by users.

MemberSignature.Value: public Node (Urho.Context context);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class Urho.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: The context that this object will be attached to.

summary.para: Constructs a new instance of Urho.Node linked to a specific .

MemberSignature.Value: protected Node (Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag);
.method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(valuetype Urho.UrhoObjectFlag emptyFlag) cil managed

Docs.summary: Empty constructor, chain to this constructor when you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.

remarks.para: This constructor should be invoked by your code if you provide your own constructor that sets the handle field.
This essentially circumvents the default path that creates a new object and sets the handle and does not call RegisterObject on the target, you must do this on your own constructor.
You would typically chain to this constructor from your own, and then set the handle to the unmanaged object from your code, and then register your object.

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddChild (Urho.Node node, uint index = 4294967295);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddChild(class Urho.Node node, unsigned int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The node to append to the scene.

param.name: index
param.para: If index is greater than current children size, append the new child at the end.

Docs.summary: Add a child scene node at a specific index.

remarks.para: This appends the child to the end of the list.
The NodeAdded event is raised if the node is currently attached to a scene.

MemberSignature.Value: public Urho.Node[] GetChildrenWithComponent<T> (bool recursive = false) where T : Urho.Component;
.method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Node[] GetChildrenWithComponent<(class Urho.Component) T>(bool recursive) cil managed

Docs.param: If true, the search includes nested children, otherwise the search is done only on the immediate children of this node.
Docs.summary: Returns children nodes that have a specific component attached to it.
Docs.returns: Array containing the nodes that have the specified component, or an empty array if there are none.
Docs.remarks: Returns only exact components of T type. Ignores subclasses of T, for example, GetChildrenWithComponent<StaticModel>() won’t return nodes with AnimatedModel components (AnimatedModels is a subclass of StaticModel).

MemberSignature.Value: public Urho.Component GetComponent (Urho.StringHash type, bool recursive = false);
.method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Component GetComponent(valuetype Urho.StringHash type, bool recursive) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of the component to lookup.
If , this performs a recursive search on the child nodes of this node.
Docs.summary: Return component by type. If there are several, returns the first.
Docs.returns: The component of the specified , if found, otherwise .
Docs.remarks: This method searches the current node for a component with an urho component type of . This will either search only the components attached to this node if recursive is set to , or it will search for the component recursive on all the children nodes attached to this node.

MemberSignature.Value: public Urho.Subscription SubscribeToAnimationTrigger (Action<Urho.AnimationTriggerEventArgs> handler);
.method public hidebysig instance class Urho.Subscription SubscribeToAnimationTrigger(class System.Action`1<valuetype Urho.AnimationTriggerEventArgs> handler) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("SubscribeTo API may lead to unxpected behaviour and will be removed in a future version. Use C# event '.AnimationTrigger += ...' instead.")

Docs.param: The handler to invoke when this event is raised.
Docs.summary: Subscribes to the AnimationTrigger event raised by the Node.
Docs.returns: Returns an Urho.Subscription that can be used to cancel the subscription.

remarks.para: This method will override any prior subscription, including those assigned to on event handlers.
This has the advantage that it does a straight connection and returns a handle that is easy to unsubscribe from.
For a more event-like approach, use the event.
